result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Daniel Allen Decker in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.
St- Plea to count 1; Dismiss count 2 in 15CF736. DRI 15CF1364 & 16CF214.
Rights Given
P- Guilty
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 1; Dismiss count 2. DRI 15CF1364 & 16CF214. Order a PSI. Bond is revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Racine County Alternatives Program

Defendant Daniel Allen Decker in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.
Def- Withdrawing the Motion to dismiss and requesting an adjournment.
St- No objection.
BTC: Adjournment granted. Motion to withdraw granted.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 09:00 am.
BACK ON THE RECORD
Def- Requesting another court date.
St- No objection.

from Racine County Alternatives Program - Incident Report
Plea hearing on October 7, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Daniel Allen Decker appears in court and with Attorney Christopher Scott Carson in court, appearing by speakerphone.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.  PSI interview has been done but document is not completed at this time.  DOC requires a plea and a conviction before the PSI will be prepared.  PSI will not be ordered until there is a conviction.  COP date set  Plea hearing scheduled for October 7, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Daniel Allen Decker in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.
St- Th defendant was interviewed but a PSI was not completed. After speaking with the PSI writer she stated that one was not going to be completed since the defendant wasn't convicted. Request another status date to have time to talk with the PSI writer.
Def- No objection.
BTC: Adjourn. Attorney Carson may appear by phone but the defendant must be present.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Daniel Allen Decker in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Brian Van Schyndel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Elizabeth Kiel.
Def- Request the SCRAM be removed. Also request a COP date.
St- Objects to the SCRAM being removed.
BTC: Bond modified to remove the SCRAM. Will have an updated PSI from 09CF1028.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
